name: Know Beatles Lyrics? Online Trivia | Beatles, The | 10 Questions

questions.text: "We all know Ob-la-di-blah-dah, but can you show me what you are?"
options: The Ballad of John and Yoko
questions.explanation:
Savoy Truffle.

	One of four Harrison contributions on the "White Album".

questions.text: "I want a short-haired girl who sometimes wears it twice as long."
options: You Know My Name, Look Up The Number
questions.explanation:
Old Brown Shoe.

	Another Harrison song from the "Hey Jude" album.

questions.text: "...though I spend my days in conversation, please remember me..."
questions.explanation:
Martha My Dear.

	Paul's song to his sheepdog.

questions.text: "I'm taking the time for a number of things that weren't important yesterday."
questions.explanation:
Fixing a Hole.

	Paul wrote the vast majority of songs on the "Pepper" Album.

Hey Bulldog.

	Left out of the American version of the film "Yellow Submarine", it is included on the DVD version.

questions.text: "A seance in the dark, with voices out of nowhere put on specially by the children for a lark."
options: The Continuing Story of Bungalow Bill
questions.explanation:
Cry, Baby, Cry.

	Charles Manson was very influenced by the "White Album", and it's not hard to see why!

questions.text: "Now that you've found another key, what are you going to play?"
options: You Never Give Me Your Money
questions.explanation:
Baby, You're a Rich Man.

	Used briefly in "Yellow Submarine". From "Magical Mystery Tour".

questions.text: "You know, the place where nothing is real."
questions.explanation:
Glass Onion.

	All of the other songs are mentioned in the song.

questions.text: "Who finds the money when you pay the rent?"
options: You Never Give Me Your Money
questions.explanation:
Lady Madonna.

	"Lady Madonna" is also mentioned in "Glass Onion".

questions.text: "Makes no difference where you are or where you'd like to be."
questions.explanation:
It's All Too Much.

	The line from "All You Need Is Love" goes "nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be."
